description.h2: An instance having a fact with non-nil content and the xml:lang attribute not starting with "en" must also contain a fact using the same element and all other attributes with an xml:lang attribute that begins with "en".
description.p: The valid values of an xml:lang attribute that begin with "en" denote variants of English, such as "en", "en-US", and "en-UK" and match the pattern en|en-[A-Z][A-Z].
Non-English content may appear but it must be translated into English.
For example, the English fact below can appear in an instance without the French fact, but the French fact cannot appear without the English fact:

variation.name: 6.5.14 French text matched with en, GOOD
variation.description: An instance with good translation, text with xml:lang="fr" matched with xml:lang="en".

variation.name: 6.5.14 French text matched with en-NZ, GOOD
variation.description: An instance with good translation, text with xml:lang="fr" matched with xml:lang="en-NZ".

variation.name: 6.5.14 French text is nil, so does not require translation, GOOD
variation.description: An instance with good translation, text with xml:lang="fr" is xsi:nil="true" so no need for translation.

variation.name: 6.5.14, Non-nil text with xml:lang="fr" and no translation, NOGOOD
variation.description: An instance with inadequate translation, non-nil text of PolicyLoansReceivablePolicy with xml:lang="fr" not matched with any xml:lang="en(-[A-Z][A-Z])?" non-nil fact.
